Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed red-brown) with two bands in added white; exterior, from left: part of large maeander; vertical dividing bands consisting of paired hook maeander pattern and dot and billet pattern; corner pendant roundel, possibly part of rising lozenge and swastika as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, a set of sherds which display patterns on the different parts of the vessel that are similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72, p. 238, no. 178)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0131) (phase 2)
